title: Snifter
text:
A snifter (also called brandy snifter, brandy glass, brandy bowl, or a cognac glass) is a type of <a href="stemware">stemware</a>, a short-stemmed <a href="Drinkware">glass</a> whose <a href="bowl%20%28vessel%29">vessel</a> has a wide bottom and a relatively narrow top. It is mostly used to serve aged brown liquors such as <a href="bourbon%20whiskey">bourbon</a>, <a href="brandy">brandy</a>, and <a href="whisky">whisky</a>.
Design.
The large surface area of the contained liquid helps evaporate it, the narrow top traps the aroma inside the glass, while the rounded bottom allows the glass to be cupped in the hand, thus warming the liquor. Most snifters will hold , but are almost always filled to only a small part of their capacity. Most snifters are designed so that when placed sideways on a level surface, they will hold just the proper amount before spilling.
A variant is called a pipe glass or pipe snifter, used for port and brandy.
Usage with beer.
The attributes that have made the snifter a popular glass for brandy have also made it a preferred glass for some styles of <a href="beer">beer</a>, mainly those that feature complex aromas and have an <a href="ABV">ABV</a> measure of 8% or higher, such as <a href="imperial%20stout">imperial stout</a>, <a href="Baltic%20porter">Baltic porter</a>, <a href="barley%20wine">barley wine</a>, and <a href="Double%20India%20Pale%20Ale">double India pale ale</a>.
